item.title: S. 1678, Uinta Research and Curatorial Center Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 15, 2004

item.title: S. 1678, Uinta Research and Curatorial Center Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on September 15, 2004

summary.text:
Uintah Research and Curatorial Center Act - Requires the Secretary of the Interior to establish the Uintah Research and Curatorial Center on land located outside the boundary of the Dinosaur National Monument in Colorado and Utah. Authorizes the Secretary to acquire such land by donation in the vicinity of Vernal, Utah. Makes the map depicting such land available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the National Park Service.

Requires the Center to be used for the curation of, storage of, and research on items in: (1) the museum collection of the Monument; and (2) any collection maintained by an entity specified in this Act that enters into a cooperative agreement with the Secretary for the curation of and research on the museum collection and the development, use, management, and operation of the Center.

Provides that land acquired for the Center shall not be part of the Monument or subject to laws and regulations applicable to the Monument.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Uinta Research and Curatorial Center Act - Requires the Secretary of the Interior to establish the Uinta Research and Curatorial Center on land located outside the boundary of the Dinosaur National Monument in Colorado and Utah. Authorizes the Secretary to acquire such land by donation in the vicinity of Vernal, Utah. Makes the map depicting such land available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the National Park Service.

Requires the Center to be used for the curation of, storage of, and research on items in: (1) the museum collection of the Monument; and (2) any collection maintained by an entity specified in this Act that enters into a cooperative agreement with the Secretary for the curation of and research on the museum collection and the development, use, management, and operation of the Center.

Provides that land acquired for the Center shall not be part of the Monument or subject to laws and regulations applicable to the Monument.

Authorizes appropriations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
